title: Add App Market pricing configuration for live publishing

requirements.text: Add a pricing configuration screen or modal that allows the app owner to set a price for their app before publishing it live to the App Market. The price input should support common currency formats (e.g., USD), include a clearly labeled affordable pricing tier suggestion (e.g., free, $0.99, $1.99, $4.99), and display the selected price prominently before confirming the go-live action.

quotes: I can set a price when the user go to live and the price is affordable

acceptanceCriteria: A pricing configuration UI is accessible when initiating a 'Go Live' / publish flow
The owner can enter or select a price (including a free option) from predefined affordable tiers
The selected price is displayed in a confirmation step before publishing
Price input validates for non-negative numeric values
The UI is consistent with the existing TradeBuddy design system (dark/light mode support)

requirements.text: Store the configured app price in the backend so it persists across sessions. Expose a method to set the price and a method to retrieve the current price.

quotes: I can set a price when the user go to live and the price is affordable

acceptanceCriteria: Backend actor exposes a `setAppPrice` method accepting a numeric (or text) price value
Backend actor exposes a `getAppPrice` method returning the currently stored price
Price persists across canister upgrades via stable storage

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui
All Motoko logic must remain in backend/main.mo as a single actor
nonGoals: Actual App Market integration or publishing pipeline (not yet available)
